result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Paul Allen Mattson was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay fine/costs of $3568.00.  Under the IDIP program pay $1844.00 with $1724.00 being stayed.  Bond be applied with balance to be paid in installments of $100.00 per month commencing 11-01-2017 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.

Sentenced to 215 days in the Pepin County Jail.  Under the IDIP Program, defendant to serve 90 days jail (with good time) with 125 days stayed upon entrance into and successful completion of the IDIP program.  Jail sentence to commence 2/21/2017 at 3:00 p.m.  2 days credit counts towards the first 48 hours without release.  Huber privileges granted for work and community service if allowed by Pepin County Jail.
Operating privileges revoked for 36 months.  Under the IDIP program, operating privileges revoked for 24 months with 12 months stayed.  Credit for time served on refusal.

Operator's license IID effective date of application.
Vehicle IID effective 45 days from 2-21-2017.
Submit to and comply with an alcohol assessment by the approved public treatment facility and comply with the development of a driver safety plan.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court finds defendant eligible for the IDIP Program.   Failure to comply with the program will result in all stays of the sentence to be lifted.

Letter from Chambers of Circuit Judge advising the defendant successfully completed the IDIP Program.  He maintained his sobriety in the community for 6 months, completed his AODA assessment and is in compliance with his DSP, performed 150 hours of community service work and paid all required program costs.  Clerk to make any necessary amendments to the JOC to reflect the IDIP penalties.

records.addlTxt: To be processed today.
Letter to IDIP Coordinator with the draft IDIP Agreement and JOC as the defendant has been approved to participate in the IDIP Program.

Defendant Paul Allen Mattson in court with attorney Joel David Schlitz.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead to count 1, joint recommendation IDIP guidelines at .188 blood, refusal deemed reasonable, dismiss count 2 and traffic citation.  Court reviews IDIP components:  1) Alcohol monitor for 6 mos. 2) Community service.  3) Alcohol Assessment.   Court advises defendant of charge of count 1/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of no contest.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court advises defendant of felony prohibitions; finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Court pronounces full sentence an make IDIP eligible and stay part announced on sheet here.  Defendant eligible for good time and credit of 2 days counts towards the first 48 hours, with work release and release for community service if approved by the jail.  Clerk to process on 2/21/17.  Court dismisses all other counts, charges, and refusal.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 14, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Paul Allen Mattson in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charge/max. penalties and rights.  State requests $1000 cash bond or $1000 Sign. Bond if defendant on alcohol monitoring.  Court sets bond in 1 of 2 ways, $1000 cash or $1000 signature bond on condition defendant on an alcohol monitor.  Condition of bond whether cash or signature, no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entry into bars or taverns.  Court encourages defendant to contac the SPD office.  Matter set for 3:00 p.m. tomorrow.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
